alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson County; Yuma (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 12 at 12:39PM MST until November 13 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Monday... .Breezy southerly winds, warm temperatures and low relative humidity values will create multiple hours of critical fire weather conditions across the area late Monday morning through the afternoon hours. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 5 PM MST MONDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 252 AND 253... The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 10 AM to 5 PM MST Monday. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 252 Yuma and 253 Kit Carson. * WINDS...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Around 14 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Upper 60s to low 70s. * IMPACTS... Rapidly spreading wildfires that may be difficult to control should one start.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or are imminent. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
